reviewText: I now have both the regular version of this disk and the Special Edition. Being a huge ELP fan, getting the extra songs on the Special Edition version was a special treat. Just seeing Pictures always left me wanting more and with this disk, I got just that.
summary: Special Edition version provides footage of songs not otherwise easy to find
Title: N/A

reviewText: Not the best ELP live disc. I prefer Live at the Royal Albert Hall or Live at Montreaux. This is cool to see them in their early days but the sound and production is just not that great.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Those cartoons. After all these years these marvel cartoons hasn't been removed from this ELP historical performance and now they are presented as psychedelic effects (laughs).This is an authentic early performance with no gimmicks or overdubs.  The band performance and image are very good and naive: K Emerson, in his brand new suit, fighting with the oscillators of his new MOOG synthesizer; G Lake is  absolutely fantastic in the breathtaking acoustic solo;  C Palmer was even then a solid drummer and it can be seen trying to get into the rhythm on a part of The Great Gates of Kiev.The extra material was already available on previous DVD Master from the Vaults.I recommend this DVD but I put one star just because the cartoons.
summary: 1 star just because those cartoons, the rest is historical
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have both Pictures at an Exhibition DVD's the Lyceum DVD, and the more well known one.While the Lyceum DVD offers a few extra songs, the cartoon overlaysare three times more annoying.  I'm as big an ELP fan as anyone, but I'm goingto pass without even watching this DVD.  One day, preferability before I passto see them 'Live in Heaven', I'd like to see the straight no cartoon version.Hey boys (ELP) your fan base isn't growing, it's getting older and wiser.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've said it before, in previous reviews:  the ELP camp consistently &^@!!?!!'s on its fan base.  After all these years...the constant complaint about this concert has been the superimposed psychodelic and cartoon crap. I read once that a "clean" videotape copy exists, sans the obnoxious effects. I've hoped against hope that someday "they'll" get it right...apparently not.  After all, these are the same people who blew it with the "Beyond the Beginning" DVD  ( California Jam footage out of sync with the audio, while stereo audio from the one-time FM simulcast exists; a disjointed montage of concert clips, etc ).Fortunately for me, another reviewer posted that the "bonus" concert is nothing other than the Masters of the Vaults footage, already out for a few years.  That footage, too, hasn't been changed...more superimposed images, albeit not as blatantly obnoxious as the Lyceum debacle.  Tell me again just where the incentive for buying this latest rip-off is?If anybody from ELP's management happens to be reading this...I won't buy this concert until you get it right.  NOBODY WANTS MARVEL COMIC BOOK CHARACTERS ON TOP OF THIS PERFORMANCE. If you STILL don't understand, back up and read this again.  That means actually going to the trouble of doing some research,and tracking down that pristine copy...we'll wait.  We'd rather you take your time, and GET IT RIGHT.
summary: WHEN will ELP's Camp Get This One Right??
Title: N/A

reviewText: DO NOT BUY! This is the worst video I have ever seen. Most of the best bits are COVERED over with someone showing off their immature psychedelic color washing or comic book pictures. If you want to SEE the musicians play, DO NOT GET this video. I should have listened to the one star comments! It seems that who ever added the junk to this concert hated ELP and didn't want you to see them. I wish my one star could be a negative 5.
Title: N/A
